A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like:
Captivating people for over 40 years\, George Lucas created Star Wars as a timeless story. 

In The Last Jedi\, much of that story is now a series of events designed to comment on the films themselves. This underlying layer of constant self-awareness\, with jokes and slapstick that intrude everywhere\, joined with cameo appearances\, quickly delivers a sense of being disposable and inauthentic.

Much of this busy middle chapter feels heavy-handed\, and substandard. There are many retreads of characters and scenarios\, often inverting the result in a desire to rapidly deconstruct Star Wars. It does not feel like we are viewing a genuine story that occurs naturally\, but instead something over scrutinized and contrived.

This movie didn't seem well made. Of all the themes it addressed\, the constant one was that Star Wars has really lost its way.
